channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2293] Be Very Careful Who You Moon...[PIC]
[+2034] Police Chase Fail
[+1831] Al Franken Reads the 4th Amendment to DOJ
item.description: Just in case he wasn’t familiar with it, Sen. Al Franken (D-Minn.) decided to read the Fourth Amendment to the Constitution to David Kris, assistant attorney general of the Justice Department’s National Security Division, who was testifying to the Senate Judiciary Committee today to urge reauthorization of expiring provisions of the USA Patriot Act

item.title: [+1826] Look Honey, I Divided by Zero! [PIC]
[+1427] Talk Nerdy To Me #2 [PIC]
[+1425] Glenn Beck Throws A Live Frog Into Boiling Water
item.description: FOX's Delusional Glenn Beck Boils & Kills A Frog On Live TV? - 09/23/09

item.title: [+1311] GOP senators declare war on Net neutrality
item.description: Six Republican Senators have introduced an amendment that would block the Federal Communications Commission from implementing its recently announced Net neutrality policy.

item.title: [+1281] What sick person would cover a cat in duct tape?
item.description: A cat was covered in duct tape from head to toe and dumped in a garden in the Rhawnhurst section of Philadelphia, the Pennsylvania Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals said.

item.title: [+1111] 1 Million Spiders Make Golden Silk for Rare Cloth
item.description: A rare textile made from the silk of more than a million wild spiders goes on display today at the American Museum of Natural History in New York

item.title: [+1077] The Evolution of a Programmer

[+854] Palin Attacks President Obama on Foreign Soil During Wartime
item.description: “Claiming to speak for Main Street USA, and the "little guys" ignored by Washington and Wall Street, Palin launched into what she claimed to be "common-sense conservatism". She delivered long but not very eloquent diatribes against politicians in general as well as government interference in the economy, the health care plans of US President ...

item.title: [+850] Schizophrenia [Comic]
item.description: An eleven page chapter from a upcoming book Psychiatric Tales

item.title: [+831] Amazing-- 1st Amateur HD Video From the Edge of Space
item.description: On August 24th, 2009, Bear-4 carried an off-the-shelf Canon Vixia HF20 HD Camera to take video at ~ 107,145 feet from a balloon. Blog post about this project here: http://bear.sbszoo.com/bear3-4/bear4.htm

item.title: [+822] Karina Smirnoff, Would Rather Dance Naked Than...[PIC]
item.description: Karina Smirnoff is not afraid to bare it all for PETA’s campaign "I’d Rather Go Naked Than Wear Fur." The DWTS dancer, has a bangin body, so we don’t see any problem looking at her naked.

item.title: [+679] CodeThatDocumentsItselfSoWellItDoesNotNeedComments
item.description: You can imagine my excitement when it came time to opening The System, which was the lead developer’s masterpiece and culminated over a decade of design and development experience into a clean, almost-perfect application.

item.title: [+655] Worst. Restaurant Names. Ever.
item.description: The fun begins before the meal's been served.

item.title: [+609] California OKs Petition Drive for Pot Legalization
item.description: Two prominent East Bay marijuana advocates got clearance from the state today to try to put a pot-legalization initiative on the November 2010 California ballot.

item.title: [+598] Windows 7 launch party parody is bleeping genius
item.description: Microsoft's cringe-inducing 'Hosting Your Party' instructional video undergoes a remix.

item.title: [+594] Lily Allen Deletes Pro-Copyright Blog and Ends Career
item.description: Yesterday it was revealed that, despite her calls for tougher anti-piracy legislation, Lily Allen herself created illicit mixtapes full of copyrighted music and made them available to the public. Today, after having rationalized why it is okay for her to pirate music, she killed her pro-copyright blog because "the abuse was getting too much."
